action.primary: Relieves toxicity, kills parasites and stops itching

indications: Important topically for scabies, tinea, Damp-festering sores, ulcers, carbuncles and recalcitrant Yin flat abscess and furuncles

action.primary: Tonifies Ming Men Fire and strengthens Yang

indications: Kidney Yang Deficiency with painful lower back and knees and impotence
Kidney and Spleen Yang Deficiencies with diarrhea
Asthma due to Kidneys unable to grasp Qi
Constipation or diarrhea in the elderly caused by Cold

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Heat signs.

useCases: Itching, Damp sores in the perineal and groin areas.
Wheezing, low back pain, and impotence due to Ming Men Deficiency and Kidneys’ inability to grasp Lung Qi.
Impotence, urinary frequency, and a cold and painful low back and extremities.
Constipation in the elderly due to Cold from Deficiency.
Chronic diarrhea from Lower Jiao insufficiency.
Asthma caused by Kidney Yang Deficiency and Cold.

notes: Both Liu Huang and Realgar #{XiongHuang} Xiong Huang resolve toxicity and kill parasites and are used in treating scabies, tinea and rashes. Liu Huang is better against tinea and itching lesions, its hot nature makes it unsuitable for treating Yang lesions. Xiong Huang is more effective at resolving toxins and treating abscesses and sores.
This herb can be used individually topically for scabies, herpetic lesions, sores and fungal infections.
